#Text=Cook Piyazi
#Text=Piyaz refers to onion in Bengali and indicates that this appetizer ’s main ingredient is onions .
#Text=This recipe originated in South Asia and is made in many South Asian households .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=1 cup of red lentils ( or other types )
#Text=Onion
#Text=1 teaspoon salt
#Text=1 teaspoon red chili powder
#Text=½ teaspoon turmeric powder
#Text=½ teaspoon cumin powder
#Text=1 teaspoon curry powder
#Text=1 teaspoon coriander powder
#Text=2 cups of vegetable oil ( or another oil )
#Text=Chili peppers
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gather the necessary ingredients .
#Text=Wash one cup of lentils and let it soak in a bowl of water for an hour .
#Text=This will make them soft .
#Text=Rinse the lentils thoroughly with water .
#Text=Prepare a bowl to add the next ingredients in .
#Text=Wash it and rinse it clean .
#Text=Blend the lentils until it becomes a thick paste .
#Text=Use a blender or immersion blender on low .
#Text=Scoop out the lentil puree into the bowl with a spoon .
#Text=Peel and dice an onion .
#Text=Remove the tip and the root of the onion .
#Text=Cut the onion in half and start dicing .
#Text=Put it into the bowl .
#Text=Put a teaspoon of salt into the bowl .
#Text=Add more if you would like .
#Text=Put a teaspoon of red chili powder .
#Text=Red chili powder is to give the lentil puree spice .
#Text=Adjust the amount of spice to your liking .
#Text=Put in one teaspoon of curry powder .
#Text=This adds a bit of seasoning and just enough spice .
#Text=Put one teaspoon of coriander powder .
#Text=Coriander powder is used to give the Piyazi aroma and a savory taste .
#Text=Put in half a teaspoon of cumin powder .
#Text=Cumin powder is used to give the Piyazi fragrance .
#Text=Put in half a teaspoon of turmeric powder .
#Text=This gives the Piyazi some color .
#Text=Mix all the ingredients together using your hands .
#Text=Wash your hands before so that they 're clean .
#Text=Put two cups of oil in frying pan and let the oil heat up on medium heat for two to three minutes .
#Text=Use any cooking oil of your choice , preferably vegetable oil .
#Text=Put the lentil paste into the frying pan in a circular shape .
#Text=Roll the lentil paste into a bite-sized ball with both hands .
#Text=Use both hands and flatten the ball into a small patty , no bigger than the palm of your hand .
#Text=Fry each side of the lentil paste for 15 minutes or until it becomes golden brown and hardened on each side .
#Text=Be sure the Piyazi is cooked thoroughly , or else it will be raw and too watery inside .
#Text=It should be crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside .
#Text=Wait 30 more minutes .
#Text=Take the Piyazi out of the frying pan .
#Text=Pat the Piyazi with paper towels to rid it of excess oil .
#Text=Let the Piyazi cool for a few minutes before enjoying a delicious snack .
#Text=Garnish the dish with chili peppers .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Bowls
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Blender
#Text=Frying Pan
